text:
In oauthlib/common.py module is defined the set of characters considered _safe_ for url encodings.

Comma `,` is not considered safe but it's commonly used as id separator in url parameters. Since [rfc3986](http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt) states comma is a _reserved_ character and since oauthlib treats other _reserved_ chars as safe:

```
urlencoded = set(always_safe) | set('=&;%+~')
```

could comma be added to the set of safe characters?
title: Comma character unsafe for urls
clean_text: In oauthlibcommonpi modul defin set charact consid safe url encod comma consid safe commonli use id separ url paramet sinc rfc3986 state comma reserv charact sinc oauthlib treat reserv char safe could comma ad set safe charact

text: Can't see any direct problems with it. Can add it before I roll a new release this week, feel free to send a PR if you want it in even quicker.
